kou commented on issue #2626: ARROW-3319: [GLib] Add align() to GArrowInputStream and GArrowOutputStream
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2626#issuecomment-424356367
 
 
   It's natural that `InputStream::Align()` and `OutputStream::Align()` in object oriented API.
   But the current `AlignStream()` in `ipc/` isn't bad because this functionality is for IPC.
   
   So both `InputStream::Align()` and `AlignStream()` in `ipc/` are natural to me.
   
   In Arrow GLib API, I prefer object oriented API because it's natural in Ruby. (Arrow GLib API is mapped to Arrow Ruby API automatically.)

+/**
+ * garrow_input_stream_advance:
+ * @input_stream: A #GArrowInputStream.
+ * @n_bytes: The number of bytes to be advanced.
+ * @error: (nullable): Return location for a #GError or %NULL.

+gboolean

+                            GError **error)
+{
+  auto arrow_input_stream = garrow_input_stream_get_raw(input_stream);
+  auto status = arrow_input_stream->Advance(n_bytes);
+  return garrow_error_check(error, status, "[input-stream][advance]");

fields.description: In some cases it may be desireable to write padding in between messages to obtain 8- or 64-byte alignment. After ARROW-3212, the IPC metadata is deterministically-sized, so alignment is up to the user
fields.summary: [GLib] Expose AlignStream methods in InputStream, OutputStream classes
